intent_atoms.description: Provide a shared distribution metadata file (DistributionMetadata.json) that contains bundle IDs, marketing version, and build numbers for the app.
Expose an API to load distribution metadata within the application code.
The DistributionMetadataLoader must correctly parse DistributionMetadata.json and expose bundle ID, marketing version, and build number values.
Unit tests in ISOInspectorKitTests/DistributionMetadataTests.swift must pass for all supported platforms (macOS, iOS, iPadOS).
Add platform-specific entitlements files for macOS, iOS, and iPadOS to support notarization.
Entitlement files ISOInspectorApp.macOS.entitlements, ISOInspectorApp.iOS.entitlements, and ISOInspectorApp.iPadOS.entitlements must be present and correctly referenced in the build process.
Provide a notarization helper script that reads shared metadata and allows dry‑run submissions from Linux CI.
The script scripts/notarize_app.sh must read DistributionMetadata.json, submit to Apple’s notarization service (or simulate), and succeed in a dry‑run mode on a Linux environment.
Codify distribution settings (bundle identifiers, versioning, entitlements) in Project.swift so that generated Tuist projects inherit these properties automatically.
All generated Xcode projects must always use the bundle identifier and marketing/version numbers defined in DistributionMetadata.json.
